options.description: Print hdc help, 'verbose' for more other cmds
Print hdc version
Use device with given connect key
List all devices status, -v for detail
Start server. If with '-r', will be restart server
Kill server. If with '-r', will be restart server
Set /system /vendor partition read-write
Wait for the device to become available
Reboot the device or boot into bootloader\recovery.
Reboot the into MODE.

Restart daemon with root permissions, '-r' to cancel root
permissions
Reboot the device, listening on USB
Reboot the device, listening on TCP port
Send file to device

Recv file from device option is -a|-s|-z
-a: hold target file timestamp
-sync: just update newer file
-z: compress transfer, not improve transmission efficiency
for compressed files
-m: mode sync
-b: send/receive file to debug application directory
Forward local traffic to remote device

Reserve remote traffic to local host
node config name format 'schema:content'
examples are below:
tcp:<port>
localfilesystem:<unix domain socket name>
localreserved:<unix domain socket name>
localabstract:<unix domain socket name>
dev:<device name>
jdwp:<pid> (remote only)
ark:pid@tid@Debugger fport ls                              - Display forward/reverse tasks
Remove forward/reverse task by taskstring

Send package(s) to device and install them
src examples: single or multiple packages and directories
(.hap .hsp)
-r: replace existing application
-s: install shared bundle for multi-apps

Remove application package from device
-k: keep the data and cache directories
-s: remove shared bundle
Show device log, -h for detail

Run shell command (interactive shell if no command given)
-b: run command in specified debug application bundle path
bundle parameter only support non-interactive shell
Return all information from the device, stored in file if FILE is specified
List PIDs of processes hosting a JDWP transport

Track PIDs of debug processes hosting a JDWP transport
-a: include debug and release processes
-p: don't display debug and release tags
Generate public/private key; key stored in FILE and FILE.pub
